attributes.action: Base GCSEs and A Levels on coursework
attributes.additional_details: This is more fair for all students because the current global pandemic has forced some students to self isolate because of coming into contact with an infected person so therefore they haven't had as much time and support as the rest of the school year to study for the subjects that they are taking this year. Exams can put teenagers under pressure and stress so when they haven't been able to do the lessons like the rest of the year it will put added stress onto them which is not fair on them!
attributes.background: Base all GCSEs and A Levels on coursework with what students have worked on throughout the school year.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326066.

We have also opened the following petitions on related issues that you may like to sign:

Triple Lock for 2021 A Levels Exam Results: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/548555 

Ensure all 2021 examinations are based on teacher assessment only: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549147  

Delay 2021 GCSE and A-level exams to allow students to catch up: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550374 

Open book exams for GCSE and A-level students sitting exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327397  


Exam arrangements and the current coronavirus pandemic can cause worry and stress. You can find information on how to deal with stress here:  

Young Minds: https://youngminds.org.uk 
Children’s Society: https://www.childrenssociety.org.uk/mental-health-advice-for-children-and-young-people/issues-affecting-young-people   
Childline: https://www.childline.org.uk/info-advice/your-feelings/anxiety-stress-panic/coping-with-stress/
